text: the following report contains flash
photography
this is the first glimpse of Britain's
secretive ground war inside Syria
British special forces helping to defend
a Syrian rebel base from the so-called
Islamic state there are small but lethal
force only a dozen men the threat here
is grave
they've come laden with weaponry to
fight their way out of any trouble these
exclusive pictures obtained by the BBC
are from June immediately after an is
attack killed their own nine of the
moderate Syrian rebels at this base and
is suicide attack on Altana
just yesterday it once belonged to is
militants and they'll determined to take
it back but the new Syrian army again
fought them off the spokesman who
doesn't want to be identified won't
comment on the pictures of British
Special Forces bunny but he does
acknowledge their help and we are
receiving Special Forces training from
British and American partners we are
also getting weapons and equipments from
the Pentagon as well as complete air
support
Cavalia w announcer c'mon be Chicago
Bashar and here's that air support in
action an American fighter taking out
another is car bomb at Alton off more
than one occasion British special forces
have crossed the border here in Jordan
but further east of here into Syria to
help the new Syrian army few groups have
received such up-close and personal
support from Britain and from America
now that closeness has led to ridicule
from the Islamic state and there have
been setbacks on the battlefield but
still the small band of Fighters
continues to endure and continues to
receive intensive support from the West
after viewing these pictures the
Ministry of Defense said it wouldn't
comment on Special Forces operations
these soldiers unlike conventional
troops don't need parliamentary approval
to be deployed the numbers may be small
but on the frontlines and the fight
against the Islamic state they're making
a difference
Quentin Somerville BBC news on the
Jordan Syria border
